Withdrawal of "Jaitun" Unit from Iraq Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 21 (KCNA) -- 30 lawmakers from ruling and opposition parties including Rim Jong In, legislator from the Uri Party, held a press conference at the building of the "National Assembly" on Nov. 16, demanding the withdrawal of the "Jaitun" unit from Iraq, according to the south Korean CBS.
 Speakers at the press conference demanded that a resolution urging the withdrawal of the unit be placed on the agenda of the session of the "National Assembly," contending that the unit may become a target of attack by resistance forces in case it takes charge of the duty to guard the UN office in Iraq, etc.

S. Korean Peasants on Indefinite Sit-in Strike 
    Pyongyang, November 21 (KCNA) -- Members of the "National Federation of Peasants Associations" are on an indefinite sit-in strike in tents before Myongdong Cathedral in Seoul in protest against the moves to railroad the sycophantic and traitorous "proposal on rice negotiations" through the "National Assembly", according to the south Korean KBS.
 They entered into the strike after piling up 1,000 straw bags of rice before Myongdong Cathedral at the dawn of Nov. 14.
 Accusing the authorities of working hard to railroad the proposal through the plenary session of the "National Assembly", they demanded the authorities withdraw it at once and take fundamental measures to save agriculture.    
 They declared that they would carry on their sit-in strike till the demands of the farmers have been met.

Anti-North Smear Campaign of S. Korean Ultra- Right Conservative Forces Assailed
    Pyongyang, November 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Council of Religionists issued a statement on Monday assailing the south Korean ultra-right conservative forces for kicking up a frantic anti-north racket over its "human rights issue". The statement termed this part of the cunning plots of the U.S. to increase its pressure upon the DPRK over its "human rights issue," while raising a hue and cry over its "nuclear issue" and threatening tougher economic sanctions, deter the inter-Korean relations from favorably improving in the June 15 era and give the ultra-right conservative forces a chance to come to power through the next "presidential election" at any cost.
 The statement branded the noisy smear campaign launched by the "General Federation of Christians of Korea" (GFCK) and other ultra-right conservative organizations against the north over its "human rights issue" as an intolerable traitorous action to chill the enthusiasm of the fellow countrymen for reunification and pursue division and confrontation among them, pursuant to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
  Accusing the pseudo religionists including the GFCK of taking the lead in kicking up the frantic anti-north racket over "its human rights issue" away from their original stand of religionists advocating love, reconciliation, peace and harmony, the statement declared the nation would never pardon them but force them to pay for their crimes generation after generation.    
  The Korean Council of Religionists expresses the expectation that the religious communities in south Korea and other parts of the world that stand for love, justice and peace would properly see through the true nature of the dastardly anti-north campaign launched by pro-American conservative forces over "its human rights issue" and dynamically join in the righteous actions to foil it, the statement noted.

    Pyongyang, November 21 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Correctly Understanding the Originality of Kimilsungism" was posted on the Internet website of the Communist Party of the United States of America (Juche) on Nov. 7.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Lebanon
    Pyongyang, November 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Emile Lahoud, president of Lebanon, on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the independence of Lebanon.
 Extending warm felicitations to the president and people of Lebanon, Kim Yong Nam wished the president success in his responsible work for the social and political stability of the country and the well-being of the people.

articles.title: KCNA Refutes U.S. Talk about "Freedom" and "Democracy"
articles.content:
Greetings to Lebanese Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, November 21 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Lebanese Prime Minister Fouad Sanyora on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the independence of its country.
 Extending warm congratulations to him, the Lebanese government and people on this occasion, the message wished him greater success in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Minister of Foreign Affairs and Immigrants Fouzi Salloukh.
